summary:
I am independent researcher, sociologist and anthropologist and have been involved with the Yugoslav democratic opposition and international network of human rights groups and organisations (for years). In Rijeka (Croatia) I worked as a curator at the Historical Museum, in Zagreb as a researcher at the University, in Amsterdam I was program adviser for Press Now (NGO active in obtaining support for the independent media in Yu during the war/s) and in The Hague for the last 12 years I was researcher in the team of experts working for the office of the Prosecutor at the UN ICTY (Tribunal for the former Yu).

Now I mostly live in The Hague (starting to write again “not-confidential” articles!). Before (and sometimes during) my UN days I published more than 30 academic articles and two books: Revolution between Freedom and Dictatorship and Urban Guerilla in Italy (the second one with Slobodan Drakulic and Claudio Venza). 

Some of my topics of interest are: political sociology and interdisciplinary research dealing with civil society, human rights, social movements, feminism, anarchism, utopia, revolutionary changes of society, political violence, war crimes, reconciliation, contact and conflict in the interaction between different cultures, migrations, identity, human nature, heresy, xenophobia, marginal groups, outsiders, social networks, communication, open source analysis, propaganda, censorship …One of the works in progress is on “Outsiders”…. 

Other activities I was/am busy with are translating, teaching, lecturing (public debates, lectures for students, politicians and journalists), editing of magazines and books, networking, organising/mediating of public events (lectures and conferences)….
